response:
Neuroimaging is required to confirm the location of lesions and demonstrate dissemination in time (gadolinium enhancement) and space. CSF analysis and autoantibody panels are essential to distinguish between MS and its mimics (NMOSD, MOGAD, Vasculitis).

investigations = ["MRI Brain with and without contrast", "MRI Cervical and Thoracic Spine with and without contrast", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Serum B12 and Folate", "Thyroid function tests", "Anti-nuclear antibody (ANA)", "Anti-Aquaporin 4 antibodies", "Anti-MOG antibodies", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology", "Lumbar Puncture (CSF for oligoclonal bands, protein, glucose, cell count)", "Visual Evoked Potentials"]
